text:
Grail was a free web browser. It was written in the Python programming language. It was made available for multiple platforms. It could have new capabilities added to it. Grail started to be made in August 1995. It had its first public release in November 1995. The last official version of Grail was version 0.6, which was released on 1 April 1999.
One feature Grail had that made it not like any other web browser was the fact it could run client-side Python code, mostly like how mainstream web browsers run client-side JavaScript code.
